thread.title: Jose Mourinho has recalled full back Luke Shaw to squad for home game against Bournemouth
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho has recalled full back Luke Shaw to squad for home game against Bournemouth

author: whaughton
title: Jose Mourinho has recalled full back Luke Shaw to squad for home game against Bournemouth
text:
Luke whose Back Jose Mourinho has recalled full back Luke Shaw to squad for home game against Bournemouth 
Shaw has been handed a life line by Jose Mourinho and is back in the Manchester United matchday squad to face Bournemouth on Saturday by Warren Haughton 3rd March 2017, 2:49 pm Updated: 3rd March 2017, 3:12 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JOSE MOURINHO has recalled Luke Shaw to Manchester United’s squad to face Bournemouth at Old Trafford on Saturday. 
Shaw has been the subject of speculation recently, with reports he could quit Old Trafford this summer in search of regular first team football. PA:Press Association 3 Luke Shaw back in from the cold and in United match day squad to face Bournemouth 
The 21-year-old full back was omitted from the EFL Cup final winning squad and has only started one game in the last three months under Mourinho. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The Portuguese coach has handed the talented defender a lifeline as he bids to save his Old Trafford career, after falling behind Daley Blind, Marcos Rojo and Matteo Darmian in the pecking order. Shaw has been told he has a future at United but must adapt his game Getty Images 3 Mourinho said Luke Shaw has been training well this week 
Mourinho said at his media briefing earlier: “Luke Shaw, I have good news for you, he is selected tomorrow, you won’t need the guys at the Lowry to see who is selected” most read in football TORRES He is in the list. One step up from not being selected. Not even on the bench. Now again he is like Wayne (Rooney) – playing or on the bench. He becomes an option again for us.” Mourinho added. Luke is working hard, he’s trying to improve, he improves by the physical point of view -with good education and good specific work. Saturday Premier League match preview featuring Liverpool v Arsenal Obviously he needs opportunities to feel alive and minutes on the pitch, to show the evolution is not just physical, but globally." The United boss added.
United could go into the four, even for a few hours if the beat Bournemouth in the lunchtime kick off at Old Trafford on Saturday.
